articles.description: Follow live text & score updates from the Europa League & Europa Conference League games, with Liverpool and Aston Villa in action later.
articles.title: Europa League: West Ham and Brighton in action - live text

articles.description: Owner John Henry has ended title droughts on both sides of the Atlantic, but neither Liverpool or Boston Red Sox fans are entirely happy with the direction he is taking their teams.
articles.title: Glory and fury - Liverpool, Boston and a tale of two teams

articles.description: Seven-time champion Ronnie O'Sullivan says he "can't be bothered any more" despite reaching the UK Championship quarter-finals.
articles.title: O’Sullivan 'can't be bothered' with snooker

articles.description: Ligue 1's bottom club Lyon sack Italian manager Fabio Grosso after just seven games in charge.
articles.title: Lyon sack Grosso after seven games in charge

articles.description: West Indies wicketkeeper Shane Dowrich announces his retirement from international cricket 10 days after a shock recall.
articles.title: Dowrich retires from West Indies duty after recall

articles.description: The Seine is due to host marathon swimming, triathlon and Paratriathlon events at the Paris 2024, but heavy rain could make that "difficult".
articles.title: Rain at Paris 2024 will make Seine events 'difficult'

articles.description: Certain members of the media "need to look at themselves" for "unfair scrutiny" of Owen Farrell, says Saracens boss Mark McCall.
articles.title: Farrell treated unfairly by media - McCall

articles.description: England fly-half Zoe Harrison will miss Saracens' game against Harlequins on 2 December after being banned for "hair pulling or grabbing".
articles.title: Harrison receives one-match ban for hair pulling

articles.description: Eddie Hearn says he will do "everything I can" to ensure Katie Taylor fights next at Croke Park and thinks the Irish Government can help make it happen.
articles.title: Hearn 'doing everything' to ensure Taylor Croke bout

articles.description: Lancashire sign Australia Test off-spinner Nathan Lyon for the 2024 County Championship season.
articles.title: Lancashire sign Australia off-spinner Lyon
